intro: Hildmannia subniger, commonly known as black hildmannia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a rough texture. Hildmannia subniger is noted for its ornamental value due to its striking floral coloration.
